abstract: Also, bringing telenovelas to Miami, more details on hacker and “party boy of the projects” Sabu and another challenge to Yahoo.
snippet: Also, bringing telenovelas to Miami, more details on hacker and “party boy of the projects” Sabu and another challenge to Yahoo.
lead_paragraph: The New Republic magazine, once described as the flight magazine of Air Force One, is being sold again, this time to Chris Hughes, a founder of Facebook who also ran President Obama’s online campaign in 2008, write Brian Stelter and Michael de la Merced. Mr. Hughes will focus his energies on the tablet version of the magazine, which will continue its print version. “Five to 10 years from now, if not sooner, the vast majority of The New Republic readers are likely to be reading it on a tablet,” he said. Richard Just will remain the editor.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: A Facebook Founder Buys TNR and Google Channels Alka-Seltzer
